title: Investigation into Fatal Shooting at 3500 Fannin
content:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Investigation into Fatal Shooting at 3500 Fannin
Houston police are investigating the fatal shooting of one man and the wounding of three others at 3500 Fannin about 1:45 a.m. on Saturday (December 31).
One victim, Kionn Oniel Lamothe, 25, was transported to an area hospital where he was pronounced dead. Three other victims, Marvin Ray Hart, Jr., 30, Herbert Lee Briscoe, 28, and Tristian Mouton, 28, were transported to area hospitals for treatment.
HPD Homicide Division Senior Police Officer L. Bailey and Officer J. Young reported:
Messrs. Lamothe, Hart, Briscoe and Mouton were at the Life Night Club at 3704 Fannin when several physical altercations started inside the club. The altercations continued outside into the street and, at some point, shots were fired. All four men were struck by the gunfire.
At this time, there are no known suspects.
Anyone with information in this case is urged to contact the HPD Homicide Division at 713-308-3600 or Crime Stoppers at 713-222-TIPS.
VHS/JFC 1-3-17
